channel.title: How do i set my ip on my source?
channel.description: how do i set my source to have the ip i want to use, and how do i make my client only use that ip without having to enter it in.

item.title: How do i set my ip on my source?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“ageofowners, post:3, topic:404919”][quote author=Smiles link=topic=501932.msg3671990#msg3671990 date=1310996516]
You don’t need to put your IP into the source because you are directly running it from your computer.

For the Client however open client.java in your Client folder.
Search for

It should look something like

OR

Either way change the 127.0.0.1 or localHost to the IP you want. Exit, Save, and Compile.
[/quote]

Why does my source say listening on 0.0.0.0:43594 when i run it and i changed the client to go to the ip but it won’t connect to the server. Do you know whats wrong?[/quote]
You can change that in Server.java or another file, but it does not affect the ip.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i set my ip on my source?

item.title: How do i set my ip on my source?
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

Or some people leave their previous IP in there, so just search “server” until you come across an IP/No-IP address.

Another possible class file, if you can’t find it, is GUI or EGUI.java (client sided).

Read full topic

item.description:
@Smiles wrote:

You don’t need to put your IP into the source because you are directly running it from your computer.

For the Client however open client.java in your Client folder.
Search for

It should look something like

OR

Either way change the 127.0.0.1 or localHost to the IP you want. Exit, Save, and Compile.
